title: The X-ray Multi-Mirror Mission
name: The X-ray Multi-Mirror Mission (XMM-Newton)
descript: The X-ray Multi-Mirror Mission (XMM-Newton) was launched by Ariane 504 on December 10 1999. XMM-Newton is ESA&rsuoq;s second cornerstone of the Horizon 2000 Science Programme. It carries high thoughput X-ray telescopes with an unprecedented effective area, and an optical monitor, the first flown on a X-ray observatory. The large collecting area and ability to make long uninterrupted exposures provide highly sensitive observations.
features: Three Wolter Type I grazing incidence gold-coated imaging X-ray telescopes

instruments.name: European Photon Imaging Camera Metal-Oxide-Silicon (EPIC-MOS)
instruments.descript: There are two EPIC-MOS units, mounted under each of the two telescopes. Each unit consists of an array of 7 CCDs, each 600 × 600 pixels.

instruments.name: European Photon Imaging Camera PN (EPIC-PN)
instruments.descript: A single instrument with an array of 12 CCDs (12 × 200 pixels each) used for spectro-imaging

instruments.name: Reflection Grating Spectrometer
instruments.descript: The gratings, mounted under each of the two telescopes, deflect about 50% of the X-ray light onto an array of 9 EPIC-MOS CCD detectors. Line density is ∼645 lines mm<sup>-1</sup> at center.

instruments.name: Optical Monitor (OM)
instruments.descript: Co-aligned 30 cm optical/UV telescope with a ∼17′ field of view and ∼1″ spatial resolution

archive: The HEASARC hosts the XMM-Newton data archive and catalogs.
